title: Lexicographically Smallest
text:
Taplu and Abhishar loved playing Scrabble. One day they thought of inventing a new game using alphabet tiles. Abhishar wrote a string using tiles and gave a set of pairs (i, j) to Taplu. Pair “i, j” (0 based indexing) means that Taplu can swap the i’th and j’th tile in the string any number of times. He then asks Taplu to give the lexicographically smallest string that can be produced by doing any number of swaps on the original string.InputFirst line contains T (1 ≤ T ≤ 10), the number of test cases.First line of each test case contains the initial string S. Length of string is len (1 ≤ len ≤ 100000).Next line contains the number of pairs M (1 ≤ M ≤ 100000).Next M lines contains pairs i j that means ith character can be swapped with jth character.Note - i and j can be same and same i, j pair can occur twice.OutputFor each testcase output the lexicographically smallest string that can be made from the initial string.ExampleInput:1
lmaf
3
0 1
1 2
2 3Output:aflm
